items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed. River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold. There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. No further significant rainfall is forecast. We continue to monitor the situation. 
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels.

floodArea.riverOrSea: Paston Brook, Werrington Brook, Marholme Brook, Brook Drain and Car Dyke Eye

items.message: Over the last few hours we have seen very heavy rainfall showers in and around the Peterborough Area. This means that Paston Brook has now risen, which will lead to flooding of low lying land and roads close to the river from this evening, Friday 9th July onward. We expect the brook to remain high for a few hours. Our forecasts indicate that flooding to properties is possible and therefore flood warnings could be issued later this evening. We are constantly monitoring river levels, and have staff in the field checking for blockages and clearing weedscreens. Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. This message will be updated as the situation changes.

items.description: River Leen and Day Brook in Nottinghamshire
items.message:
River levels have risen at the Day Brook river gauge as a result of localised thunderstorms.  Consequently, flooding  is possible tonight, 09/07/21.  Areas most at risk are low-lying recreational areas and roads including High School playing fields on Valley Road and other low lying land and recreational areas.   
Thunderstorms are forecast over the next 24 hours, with low confidence over exact timing and locations.  
We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are clearing weed screens.  
Please avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses and avoid contact with flood water.  
This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 10/07/21, or as the situation changes.
